Vision¶

Croppings Script¶

class vision.calibrate.Configure(pitch)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Configure class supplies a simple GUI for identifying cropping positions and zones.

draw(event, x, y, flags, param)[source]¶

Callback for the Mouse button press event. Detects if a mouse button is pressed and appends this position to our list of drawn points, and displays a point on the frame to indicate the press.

draw_poly(points)[source]¶

Draws a series of points as a polygon onto our frame.

Parameters:points – A series of polygon points
get_goal(zone)[source]¶

Returns the top and bottom corner of the goal for the given zone by sorting the points into extreme left / right x-positions and retrieving the first/last two points.

Writes the given positions under the Zone_X_goal key into croppings.

get_pitch_outline()[source]¶

Prompts the user to draw the Pitch outline as a series of points, then users these as extreme values to crop the camera image to these points and mask the outer edges to remove outer noise.

get_zone(key, message)[source]¶

Initialises the request for positions of a new zone. Assigns the zone’s key as the new drawing index and begins tracking points.

Parameters:
  • key – The area’s key: [‘outline’, ‘Zone_0’, ‘Zone_1’, ‘Zone_2’, ‘Zone_3’]
  • message – The message to prompt the user
reshape()[source]¶
run(camera=False)[source]¶

Run constructs a new OpenCV window, displays the frame for cropping and begins the routine of the program asking for user input.

Parameters:camera – True indicates using the camera feed, False will use a image entitled ‘00000001.jpg’ instead.
sortPoly(points)[source]¶

Color Properties¶

Convenience setup colours values for GUI drawing.

Threshold GUI¶

class vision.findHSV.CalibrationGUI(calibration)[source]¶

Bases: object

CalibrationGUI sets up a simple GUI showing a frame coupled with a series of trackbars offering thresholding of the frame and a mask showing the results.

change_color(color)[source]¶

Switches from the previous colour configuration to a new one, displaying the new trackbar values and configuration.

get_mask(frame)[source]¶

Applies the given contrast / blur preprocessing steps to the frame and then thresholds using our HSV settings.

Parameters:frame – A frame to preprocess and threshold
Returns:A masked frame, masked using our settings with preprocessing applied.
setWindow()[source]¶

Sets up the calibration window with the trackbars assigned to the settings available in calibration dictionary.

show(frame, key=None)[source]¶

Called whenever a new frame is available, displays the new frame and performs thresholding, displaying the resultant masked image. Also attempts to perform any changes due on the given keypress.

Parameters:
  • frame – The new image frame to threshold
  • key – A character keypress code

class vision.tracker.RobotTracker(color, crop, offset, pitch, name, calibration)[source]¶

Bases: vision.tracker.Tracker

find(frame, queue)[source]¶

Retrieve coordinates for the robot, it’s orientation and speed - if available.

Process:
  1. Find green plate
  2. Create a smaller frame with just the plate
  3. Find dot inside the green plate (the smaller window)
  4. Use plate corner points from (1) to determine angle
Params:
[np.array] frame - the frame to scan [multiprocessing.Queue] queue - shared resource for process
Returns:
None. Result is put into the queue.
get_dot(frame, x_offset, y_offset, plate_corners)[source]¶

Find center point of the black dot on the plate.

Method:
  1. Assume that the dot is within some proximity of the center of the plate.
  2. Fill a dummy frame with black and draw white cirlce around to create a mask.
  3. Mask against the frame to eliminate any robot parts looking like dark dots.
  4. Use contours to detect the dot and return it’s center.
Params:
frame The frame to search x_offset The offset from the uncropped image - to be added to the final values y_offset The offset from the uncropped image - to be added to the final values
get_plate(frame)[source]¶

Given the frame to search, find a bounding rectangle for the green plate

Returns:
list of corner points
kmeans(plate)[source]¶

class vision.vision.Vision(pitch, color, our_side, frame_shape, frame_center, calibration)[source]¶

Locate objects on the pitch.

get_adjusted_point(point)[source]¶

Given a point on the plane, calculate the adjusted point, by taking into account the height of the robot, the height of the camera and the distance of the point from the center of the lens.
